title: Mikheil Meskhi Stadium
text: The Mikheil Meskhi Stadium, also known as the Lokomotivi Stadium, is a <a href="multi-purpose%20stadium">multi-purpose stadium</a> in <a href="Tbilisi">Tbilisi</a>, <a href="Georgia%20%28country%29">Georgia</a> named after the famous Georgian international footballer, <a href="Mikheil%20Meskhi">Mikheil Meskhi</a>. It is used mostly for <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> matches, and occasionally for <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> and <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> matches. The stadium was renovated in 2001 and has a capacity to hold 27,223 people. It is the second largest stadium in Georgia, after the <a href="Boris%20Paichadze%20Stadium">Boris Paichadze Stadium</a>.
